title: MassHealth NEMT Brokerage Services
agency: Massachusetts Executive Office of Health and Human Services
description: Non-emergency medical transportation brokerage services for MassHealth members. Includes scheduling, dispatching, and coordination of wheelchair van, stretcher, and ambulatory transport across all Massachusetts counties. Broker must maintain network of qualified NEMT providers.
keywords_matched: nemt; non-emergency medical; medical transport; wheelchair; stretcher; ambulatory; non-emergency; medical transportation
notes: Large statewide contract. Check COMMBUYS for RFP updates. Previous contract held by regional broker.

title: MBTA The RIDE Paratransit Supplement - South Shore Zone
description: Supplemental paratransit transportation services for MBTA The RIDE program covering the South Shore service zone. Requires ADA-compliant vehicles, wheelchair lifts, and trained operators. Estimated 200 trips per week.
notes: Subcontracting opportunity under main RIDE contract. Contact MBTA procurement for vendor registration.

title: Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center - Patient Shuttle Contract
description: Patient shuttle transportation services between Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center campuses in Boston and surrounding communities. Services include wheelchair-accessible vehicles, scheduled routes, and on-demand patient transfers between facilities. Seeking qualified transport vendors with healthcare experience.
notes: Private hospital contract. Multi-campus shuttle service. Healthcare transport experience preferred.

title: Blue Cross Blue Shield MA - NEMT Vendor Network Expansion
agency: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts
description: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts is expanding its non-emergency medical transportation vendor network. Seeking licensed NEMT providers to serve members across all Massachusetts regions. Providers must have compliant vehicles, trained drivers, and ability to integrate with BCBS scheduling systems. Rolling enrollment for qualified providers.
keywords_matched: nemt; non-emergency medical; medical transport; non-emergency; medical transportation
notes: Rolling enrollment - no hard deadline. BCBS MA expanding NEMT provider network statewide. Good opportunity for established NEMT operators.

title: Amazon DSP (Delivery Service Partner)
description: Start your own delivery business with Amazon. DSP owners manage teams of drivers delivering Amazon packages. Requires $10K liquid capital minimum. | Requirements: Business entity, $10K+ liquid capital, pass background check | Earning Potential: $75K-$300K annually (business owner)

title: Amazon Flex
description: Deliver Amazon packages using your own vehicle on flexible schedules. Independent contractor gig work for individual drivers. | Requirements: Valid license, own vehicle, smartphone, pass background check | Earning Potential: $18-$25/hour

title: FedEx Ground ISP (Independent Service Provider)
description: Own and operate FedEx Ground delivery routes. ISP model allows owning multiple routes and managing driver teams. | Requirements: Business entity, significant capital investment, fleet of vehicles | Earning Potential: $100K-$500K+ annually per route cluster
notes: Category: Freight | Earning: $100K-$500K+ annually per route cluster

title: Uber Freight
description: Book and manage freight loads through Uber Freight platform. For carriers and owner-operators with CDL and commercial vehicles. | Requirements: CDL, commercial vehicle, MC/DOT authority | Earning Potential: Varies by load and lane
notes: Category: Freight | Earning: Varies by load and lane

title: XPO Logistics
description: Partner with XPO for last-mile, LTL, and truckload freight opportunities. Independent contractor and fleet owner programs available. | Requirements: CDL, commercial vehicle, insurance, MC/DOT authority | Earning Potential: Varies by contract type
notes: Category: Freight | Earning: Varies by contract type

title: Uber (Rideshare)
description: Drive passengers or deliver food with Uber and Uber Eats in the Boston/Massachusetts market. | Requirements: Valid license, vehicle meeting requirements, background check | Earning Potential: $15-$35/hour before expenses

title: Lyft
description: Rideshare driving in Massachusetts. Flexible scheduling with passenger transport throughout the Boston metro area. | Requirements: Valid license, vehicle meeting requirements, background check | Earning Potential: $15-$30/hour before expenses

title: DoorDash
description: Food and grocery delivery in Massachusetts. Flexible gig work as an independent Dasher contractor. | Requirements: Valid license, vehicle/bike/scooter, smartphone, background check | Earning Potential: $15-$25/hour before expenses

title: Instacart
description: Grocery shopping and delivery service. Shop and deliver groceries to customers in Massachusetts. | Requirements: Valid license, vehicle, smartphone, ability to lift 40+ lbs | Earning Potential: $12-$25/hour before expenses

title: Grubhub
description: Food delivery in the Greater Boston area and across Massachusetts. Flexible scheduling as independent delivery partner. | Requirements: Valid license, vehicle, smartphone, background check | Earning Potential: $12-$22/hour before expenses

title: Modivcare (formerly Providence Service Corp)
description: Major NEMT broker operating in Massachusetts. Contracts with Medicaid/Medicare plans for non-emergency medical transportation. Seeking qualified transport providers. | Requirements: Licensed NEMT provider, compliant vehicles, trained drivers, insurance | Earning Potential: $25-$45/trip depending on service level
notes: Category: NEMT | Earning: $25-$45/trip depending on service level

title: MTM Inc
description: National NEMT broker managing transportation for health plans. Active in Massachusetts Medicaid transportation network. | Requirements: Licensed NEMT provider, compliant vehicles, background checks, insurance | Earning Potential: $20-$40/trip depending on service level
notes: Category: NEMT | Earning: $20-$40/trip depending on service level

title: Veyo
description: Technology-driven NEMT platform. Connects qualified drivers with non-emergency medical transport rides. Active in multiple states including MA. | Requirements: Valid license, 4-door vehicle, smartphone, background check | Earning Potential: $18-$30/hour
